name: webanno.custom.IGCoreRegulativeComponentRelationship

features.name: Exhaustive
features.description: Indicates that relationships are exhaustive (i.e., statement does not use terms that signal open-ended relationships, such as "including", but lists all possible alternatives)

features.name: LogicalRelationship

tags.tag_description: Indicates AND relationship, i.e., conjunction of components. The relationship is undirected.

Describes a combination of statements, where the occurrence of the action specified in the first statement is combined with the non-occurrence of the action specified in the second statement. The relationship is directed; the target is the non-occurring action statement.
Indicates AND/OR relationship (OR) in which both components may apply, or either one of those, i.e., an inclusive disjunction. The relationship is undirected.

Describes a NEITHER-NOR (NOR) relationship of components, where the non-occurrence of the first component is combined with the non-occurrence of the second component of the same type. The relationship is undirected.
Indicates an EITHER-OR (XOR) relationship, i.e., exclusive disjunction. The relationship is undirected.

features.description: Indicates type of logical relationship amongst components

features.name: PrecedenceofComponentCombinations
features.description: Indicates precedence among component relationships. Lower values imply lower precedence/priority.

features.name: Separable
features.description: Indicates whether logically-linked elements can be separated for analytical purposes, or whether they are only used in conjunction (e.g., fish and chips, Smith and Sons).

description: Captures logical relationships between institutional grammar components of the same type (e.g., multiple aims or attributes).

name: webanno.custom.IGCoreRegulativeSyntax

features.name: Additionallabels
features.description: Identifies additional custom labels. Signal labels as key-value pairs (e.g., key=value) and separate multiple labels by | (e.g., key1=value|key2=value).

features.name: Animacy

tags.tag_description: Indicates animate entity
Indicates inanimate entity

features.description: Animacy annotation for specific component types

tags.tag_description: Direction - References to directions, inclusion of intermediary locations (e.g., “via”)
Location - References to specific locations
State - References to a specific state
State Transition/Process - References a change in state or a process reflecting change in state
Indicates the beginning of a time frame
Indicates the end of a time frame
Indicates frequency expression
Point in time - References to specific points in time
Time Frame - References to time frames
Concept - References to concepts to or for which the statement applies
Exception - Expression of exception to general rule (e.g., "unless ...")
Method - Reference to means (e.g., artifact, tool) or manners (e.g., handshake) mediating activity
Observed Effect/Outcome - Conditions/Constraints describing the outcome or effect of an aim by an actor involved in the action situation (e.g., "Upon observing non-compliance, ...").
Origin - Identifies the context as input, e.g., based on its origin.
Procedural Order - Context specifications associated with explicit or implied execution order, i.e., performing one action depends on completion of another
Process - Reference to process specification an action needs to comply with or otherwise relates to
Purpose/Function - Conditions/Constraints describing the purpose or intent of an aim

features.name: Component

tag_set.name: IG Core Regulative Components
tag_set.description: Institutional Grammar Component Annotations for Regulative Statements

tags.tag_description: An actor (individual or corporate/organization) that carries out, or is expected to carry out, the action (i.e., Aim) of the statement.
Attribute Properties that characterize the actor further
Direct objects are receiver of the action captured in the Aim
Direct object properties
Indirect objects are objects that are affected or targeted by the application of the Aim to direct objects.
Indirect object properties
Activation conditions instantiate the Aim indicated in an institutional statement.
Execution constraints qualify the Aim indicated in an institutional statement.
A prescriptive operator that describes whether the Aim of an institutional statement is permitted (e.g., may), obliged (e.g., shall, must), or forbidden (e.g., shall not, must not).
The goal or action of the statement assigned to the statement Attribute.

features.traits: {"multipleRows":false,"collapsedRows":1,"expandedRows":1,"keyBindings":[{"keyCombo":"a","value":"(A) Attribute"},{"keyCombo":"w","value":"(A, prop) Attribute_Property"},{"keyCombo":"b","value":"(Bdir) Object_Direct"},{"keyCombo":"h","value":"(Bdir, prop) Object_Direct_Property"},{"keyCombo":"n","value":"(Bind) Object_Indirect"},{"keyCombo":"j","value":"(Bind, prop) Object_Indirect_Property"},{"keyCombo":"c","value":"(Cac) Activation Condition"},{"keyCombo":"x","value":"(Cex) Execution Constraint"},{"keyCombo":"d","value":"(D) Deontic"},{"keyCombo":"i","value":"(I) Aim"}]}

features.name: InstitutionalStatement
features.description: Indicates whether the component is or embeds an institutional statement in its own right.

features.name: Impliesnegation
features.description: Indicates whether component expression implies negation (e.g., must NOT; does NOT apply to ...; No individual ...).

features.name: Inferredcomponentvalue
features.description: If the component value is largely implicit (e.g., "it"), this field is filled with the explicit content the component resolves to (e.g., "the author").

features.name: PhysicalEntity
features.description: Indicates whether the entity is physical (e.g., actor, object) or non-physical (e.g., thought, belief)

features.name: RegulativeFunction

tag_set.name: IG Regulative Functions
tag_set.description: Regulative functions (as a specialization of institutional functions in the context of regulative statements) characterize operational actions in terms of analytical objectives and theoretical perspectives (e.g., signalling compliance or violation; life cycle stages). The tagset is extensible.

tags.tag_description: The component indicates compliance behavior.
The component indicates monitoring behavior.
The component indicates regulative-incentivizing behavior.
The component indicates regulative-punitive behavior.
The component indicates violation behavior.

features.description: Indicates the regulative function associated with the statement as signaled by the aim.

description:
Identifies institutional statement components for regulative statements

IG Profile Version: 0.2.4
For all versions, see https://github.com/InstitutionalGrammar/IG-Inception-Layers/releases
